summary: Earlier, we estimated that more than $100 billion was lost to fraud in unemployment insurance programs during the pandemic. We also found higher rates of fraud in the Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program. This Q&A report examines state efforts to fight fraud in this program. States were challenged to rapidly start the program and establish anti-fraud measures. Our survey found that states used multiple tools, such...
title: Pandemic Unemployment Assistance: States' Controls to Address Fraud
